title: Replacement for C.U.I.T. (CPU usage in Tray)
content:
Description from Softpedia: CPU Usage in Tray is a CPU tray monitor. A lightweight software application developed specifically for helping you keep an eye on your CPU usage from the Windows system tray area.

[url=https://www.softpedia.com/get/System/System-Info/CPU-Usage-in-Tray.shtml]Download CPU Usage in Tray 1.0.1/url

I've been using this neat little utility for years, but development was ceased quite some time back. It still works, but the problem is that it randomly shuts down and has to be relaunched.

I'm hoping someone is familiar with something similar. See screenshot. The top four numbers are my four cores cpu usage.
creator: noel_envoide

title: Ad Blockers Slowing Page Loading on Startup
content:
Hi,

This is a specific problem whose solution I was unable to find, which is why I am posting here. For quite a long time (I'm not sure when since it has been long enough that I have more or less accepted it at this point), I am having an issue with page loading while I have an Ad Blocker installed. It doesn't matter which one it is, as long as I have one installed and enabled, it takes around 3-5 minutes for any page to load when I first start Firefox. This is especially prevalent when I have just started up my computer, compared to if I had used Firefox just a while ago and am opening it again, in which case the duration is shorter, but still around 2-3 minutes.

I have tried multiple ad blockers, such as uBlock Origin, AdBlock, AdBlock Plus and AdNauseam, but I'm facing this issue with all of them. I know it's the ad blocker because whenever I disable it, the pages which were otherwise not loading, load immediately, but with ads. If I enable the ad blocker again, I still have to wait the duration I would otherwise have to, for the page to continue loading or website to continue working.

I would like to know some way around this issue aside from disabling the ad blocker altogether, or a suggestion for a different ad blocker would also be welcome, as long as I can get rid of this issue.

Current Firefox version: 86.0.1 (64-bit)

I've had this issue persistently over several versions over the last couple of years.

content:

title: Using HTTPS/SSL Proxy with Firefox
content:
Hello Community,

I have one question/problem regarding configuration of HTTPS Proxy. I have HTTPS Proxy (actually 2 of them, Squid and MITM) one of which I would like to use with FF. This is where the things are start to get interesting.

When I use PAC file which has statement which directs things over HTTPS proxy:

return "HTTPS my.proxy.local:443"

Everything works...

However, when I use FF Network Settings and enter either of them into the field SSL/HTTPS Proxy, only thing which I get is "Secure connection failed"... I tried all constellations of fields in there, but no luck.

Can somebody tell me why is it like this? Is this a bug or standard behaviour? If this is a standard behaviour, what is the difference between GUI and PAC settings.

Thank you in advance, Neven

title: Firefox does not show all speakers as options in Google Voice
content:
Hello,

I've been a Firefox user as far back as the days of Phoenix. I've been using it as my main browser whenever possible on both Windows and Linux over that time.

I've also been a long time Google Voice user.

I've always had to work around an issue using Google Voice with Firefox. I have to switch the OS's default speaker device in order to get the call sound to play through an attached headset. Google Voice has a menu where I should be able to select from the available devices attached to the system but under Firefox I am only able to see System speaker default device.

Is this a known issue? Is there any workaround? It's fairly annoying to have to switch this under the OS settings as it changes the behavior for all of my apps. I would very much prefer to be able to make this selection at the application (Firefox) level.

Thanks, Dave

content:

I've set "youtube" as a keyword to search YouTube videos. So, if I type "youtube football", it'd act as if I'm searching for football in YouTube and the results will come out like how YouTube normally would.

The issue I have is after this, if I choose to watch any of the video and say I finish and want to watch another results I search for and press "Back", it'll load the same video again, it doesn't go back to the search results, which was supposed to be the last page. Even when I only right click on the "Back" icon, it displays as "football - YouTube", but if I press back, it just replaces the page to playing the same video again. Pressing back again will go back to whatever page I was on before the search.

title: Pandora website not functioning, cookie issue
content:
I am unable to use Pandora. This started within the past week or so. The website loads, looks normal, but the play button and station switch buttons do not work, no music plays. However, if I log out and log back in, it does work fully, until I either refresh the page or close the browser window. Then, when the page loads, the play/station buttons no longer work. I have to log out and then log back in again to restore functionality.

I verified Pandora works fine on Chrome, IE, and Edge on this PC and other PC's in my house.

Firefox version 88 on Windows 10, I have restarted the PC, cleared cookies, clicked "forget about this website" under history, I have turned 'enhanced traffic protection" off for the site, I have added pandora.com as an allowed exception for cookies.

The only change I can remember making in the past few weeks is removing Flash from my PC.

Attached is the error log. I put a green line where after the website finished loaded, I hit the play button. The issue must before before that green line button, because it should autoplay. It does after I clear the cookies and log in. I don't know anything about how to decipher this information, so any help is greatly appreciated!

title: Decisiones de Autenticación Firefox 87 Desactivar
content:
He visto que en la versión 87 después de entrar en alguna web con el certificado digital se queda grabado en opciones de seguridad y privacidad, certificados, decisiones de autenticación. Resulta que cada vez que entro en cualquier web con certificado digital tengo que ir a la dirección anteriormente expuesta para borrar dicha decisión. ¿Cómo se puede evitar que quede recogido el certificado usado en decisiones de autenticación? ó ¿Cómo conseguir que el check que sale en la parte inferior al seleccionar un certificado (recordar esta decisión), saga por defecto desactivado? Uso varios certificados y tengo que estar continuamente o borrando los que se quedan guardado en las decisiones de autenticación o tengo que estar continuamente despicando el check para que no recuerde el cetificado usado.

Saludos y gracias por vuestra ayuda

title: Vote message :  YD a créé une nouvelle révision du document Protection renforcée contre le pistage dans Firefox pour ordinateur.
content:
Bonjour depuis plusieurs jour je reçoit le message en copie plus bas. Que dois-je faire avec cette information un peut technique pour moi ? y a-t'il un paramétrage important à faire ? merci de me répondre, et me rassurer... et me dire quoi faire ou pas faire...

Cordialement jeanhugues un utilisateur satisfait depuis longtemps à votre alternative à 'l'autre monde '! "" YD a créé une nouvelle révision du document Protection renforcée contre le pistage dans Firefox pour ordinateur. Le panneau Préférences/Options devient Paramètres (cf. barre de titre). Je ne suis pas la màj. 220075. Consultez l’historique de ce document Résumé : La protection renforcée contre le pistage dans Firefox protège automatiquement votre vie privée pendant que vous naviguez sur Internet. Modifications : --- [fr] Protection renforcée contre le pistage dans Firefox pour ordinateur #220077 +++ [fr] Protection renforcée contre le pistage dans Firefox pour ordinateur #220183 @@ -77,7 +77,7 @@ 

=Ajuster ses paramètres globaux de protection renforcée contre le pistage= Quand vous téléchargez et installez Firefox, toutes les protections incluses dans le niveau Standard de la protection renforcée contre le pistage sont déjà activées.

-Pour consulter ou modifier vos paramètres de protection renforcée contre le pistage pour tous les sites, cliquez sur le bouclier {for not fx89}{/for}{for fx89}{/for} que vous pouvez voir à gauche de la barre d’adresse quand vous visitez n’importe quel site web et sélectionnez {menu Paramètres de protection} dans le panneau qui se déploie. Le panneau Vie privée et sécurité des {for not fx89}[[T:optionsorpreferences]]{/for}{for fx89}Préférences{/for} de Firefox s’ouvre alors dans un nouvel onglet. +Pour consulter ou modifier vos paramètres de protection renforcée contre le pistage pour tous les sites, cliquez sur le bouclier {for not fx89}{/for}{for fx89}{/for} que vous pouvez voir à gauche de la barre d’adresse quand vous visitez n’importe quel site web et sélectionnez {menu Paramètres de protection} dans le panneau qui se déploie. Le panneau Vie privée et sécurité des [[T:optionsorpreferences]] de Firefox s’ouvre alors dans un nouvel onglet. 

;{for not fx89}{/for}{for fx89}{/for} {note}Astuce : ces paramètres sont aussi disponibles depuis le menu de Firefox :

Cliquez sur le bouton de menu puis sur {menu [[T:optionsorpreferences]]} et sélectionnez enfin {menu Vie privée et sécurité}{/note} ""

title: WorkGuru
content:
Hi There, I am about to use WorkGuru as a time management program. I can log-on to the program/site using Google Chrome, but when I attempt to log on with firefox I get a "Login failed" notification of "invalid user name or password". I have attempted numerous times being very careful with my password and user name (which works on chrome). When queried, the WorkGuru salesman responded,

"WorkGuru and most of the other modern SaaS / cloud applications recommended Google Chrome or new Microsoft Edge which is built on Chromium engine as the primary web browser. I have not tested it on Mozilla's browser personally."

So not much help from WorkGuru as obviously I could just suck it up and use chrome. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

I am running firefox 88.0 on Windows 10. google.com is my home page. Lately, the search box in the middle of the screen is simply gone. This is the one with "Google Search" and "I'm feeling lucky" buttons, also gone. If I run Edge on the same machine the box is there. Likewise it is fine on Linux. Other Windows 10 machines I've check are also OK. The only difference I can see off-hand is that the problem computer is 32bit.

Any ideas?

title: Screen Share Window Selection Crashes Computer
content: Intermittently when I try to share my screen (Discord, Webex, etc...) my entire computer freezes and becomes unresponsive, the only way I can fix it is to hard reboot by holding the power button. It hurts my heart every time I have to do it, especially because of how new my computer is.
creator: aaronjencks

title: HTTPS redirection behavior changed in 88.0
content:
I have to access a number of HTTP (not S) servers on a private work network. The URLs all look like http://resource.infra.example.com. Using Firefox 88.0 the protocol URL is automatically changed to https:// and I get an error "Unable to connect. Firefox can’t establish a connection to the server at recourse.infra.example.com". This makes sense because these servers are not HTTPS, but Firefox's behavior seems broken.

I *do* get redirected with a fresh profile in Firefox 88.0. I *do* get redirected in safe mode in Firefox 88.0. I *do* get redirected in Firefox 89.0b4. I *do* get redirected in >= 88.0 regardless of whether HTTPS Only is enabled in Preferences (if it's enabled I get the new HTTP warning, and then I get redirected to HTTPS) I *don't* get redirected in Firefox 87.0 (regardless of profile or safe mode) I *don't* get redirected in Safari and Chrome. I *don't* get redirected by curl. Inspecting these sites's headers with curl gives:

$ curl -sI http://resource.infra.example.com HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Length: 4198 Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8 Date: Wed, 28 Apr 2021 02:43:01 GMT Etag: W/"1066-CEROUmmTJBPO73vecAgQwYdTSow" Vary: Accept-Encoding X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff X-Dns-Prefetch-Control: off X-Download-Options: noopen X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN X-Xss-Protection: 1; mode=block

It seems like something changed in 88.0, but I don't see anything related to HTTPS in the 88.0 release notes: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/88.0/releasenotes/.

What changed? How can I fix it?
creator: cottonplane

title: This page is slowing down Firefox. To speed up your browser, stop this page.
content:
I have an web app I can not control and have to use at work. It constantly all the time every day causes firefox to halt for 10-25 seconds, and displays the black banner with the robot dude "this page is slowing down firefox. to speed up your browser, stop this page".

Restart firefox, removing unnecessary add ons etc I know are the general guidelines.

What I am wondering is is there a log or somewhere specifically in the console/debugger etc I can look to find more information about why it is doing that. I am not a web developer but if I can get some idea about whats causing that I'd have more info to share with the web apps admins.

I can't do anything live, because it really locks up all of firefox but is there a corresponding message afterwards I could look for in the console?
creator: tbv624+firefox
